channel.title: New Engine Cache Reader
channel.description:
[B]Hello all.[/B]
I havent released anything in awhile since i have been working on my [B]Typhoon[/B] rewrite. I have current wrote a Cache Reader that supports the 400 > 604 and 605+ cache support. The naming isn't perfect and if any of you find any issues with the naming, please provide the relevent information and i will fix it. I tested this and it does work, i ripped the ItemDef class from dragonkk 613 release to test it, but removed it in this release because it was ugly :awesome:.
Credits:
[B]Tom[/B] - Decompression Methods [B]PeeHPee[/B] - a few tweeks to the code. [B]Method[/B] - He informed me that the 605+ FIT uses the Whirlpool hash. [B]XLogic[/B] - I got sent his cache reader but it was very ugly so i rewrote it. If it wasn't for him, then this wouldnt be released.
Link: [url=http://uppit.com/qh1b7l39nhqt/typhoon-cache.rar]UppIT - Free File hosting - cache.rar[/url]
Some of the code if a bit yukky and does need a better way of doing it, but it works. Help:
If you want it to support the new fit, then simply do this in the CacheIndex class.
[CODE]this.cacheFIT = new FileInformationTable(id, index255, Format.NEW);[/CODE]
and to support the old header simply do.
[QUOTE]this.cacheFIT = new FileInformationTable(id, index255, Format.OLD);[/QUOTE]
Let the haters hate.
I am Sir Sean/Lord Sean from r-s.
[b]Edit:[/b]
Ive also released 614 sprite dump, that can be located at
http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,452525.0.html

I havent released anything in awhile since i have been working on my Typhoon rewrite. I have current wrote a Cache Reader that supports the 400 > 604 and 605+ cache support. If you want it to support the new fit, then simply do this in the CacheIndex class.
